curam.util.client.model

Interface Component

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Container, Field

    public interface Component
extends java.io.Serializable
    A component is the base for all controls on a page and all of the containers for those controls. This is only a model of the controls that has no specified visual representation. Components are converted to a visual representation by renderers.

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gets the title of the component.
        Returns:
        The title. May be null.

      • getTitleText

        curam.util.client.model.Text getTitleText()
        Gets the title Text of the component.
        Returns:
        The title text. May be null.

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Gets the description (or sub-title) of the component.
        Returns:
        The description. May be null.

      • getDescriptionText

        curam.util.client.model.Text getDescriptionText()
        Gets the description (or sub-title) Text of the component.
        Returns:
        The description text. May be null.

      • getHelpText

        java.lang.String getHelpText()
        Gets the help text for the component.
        Returns:
        The help text. May be null.

      • getIcon

        java.net.URI getIcon(int state)
        Gets the URI of the icon representing the given icon state. The default icon will be returned if the state is not supported.
        Parameters:
        state - The state for which an icon is required.
        Returns:
        The icon URI.

      • getParameters

        ComponentParameters getParameters()
        Gets the map defining name/value pairs of parameters that provide more information about this component. The map can also provide default values for parameters that were not set explicitly. See ComponentParameters.getWithDefault(String) for details. The parameters cannot be modified.
        Returns:
        The collection of parameters.

      • getUserObject

        java.lang.Object getUserObject()
        Gets the component's user object which can be used to carry implementation specific meta-data about the component.
        Returns:
        The user Object

      • getStyle

        Style getStyle()
        Gets the style associated with this component and that will determine how the component is rendered. Not all components have a style; for example, the Field component may use a domain instead of a style.
        Returns:
        The style associated with this component, or null if it has no defined style.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the component's name which defines the actual type of the component.
        Returns:
        The component's name which defines the actual type of the component.

      • getID

        java.lang.String getID()
        Gets the component's unique identifier.
        Returns:
        The component's unique identifier.

      • getLink

        Link getLink()
        Gets the link object for the component.
        Returns:
        The Link object associated with the component.

      • getConnectors

        java.util.Collection<Connector> getConnectors()
        Gets a collection of connector objects for the component. The collection will never be null, but it may be empty. The connectors cannot be modified. The iteration order is the same as the order in which the connectors were added when this component was built.
        Returns:
        The collection of connector objects.
